abstract: Britain's Liberal Democrat party, which appears sure to lose Parliament seats in May election, may still play key role in country's power balance; party's leader Nick Clegg has been criticized by Labour and Conservative party leaders and voters have blamed him for coalition government's spending cuts; experts say, however, that seats held by party could help tilt makeup of government.
lead_paragraph: The popularity of Mr. Clegg and his Liberal Democrats has suffered in five years as junior partner in a coalition government, yet experts say they could once again tilt the balance of power.

headline.main: Nick Clegg, a Star of Britain’s 2010 Election, Faces a Tough Fight
headline.print_headline: Even Facing Losses, Britain’s Liberal Democrats Play Key Role

snippet: The popularity of Mr. Clegg and his Liberal Democrats has suffered in five years as junior partner in a coalition government, yet experts say they could once again tilt the balance of power.
